title: Added hidden input support
body:
Hi,

I think it would be a nice feature to support hidden form inputs. In my own case, I needed this to achieve what I want and here we are.

**Example use case:** 

Suppose you store an array of objects. Every property of these objects should be editable by the client but the requirement is to be able to tell that if all the properties of an object are modified completely or if that object is newly added to the array. With hidden inputs, you can easily store some id for the objects and can tell if an object is newly created or if all the fields of the object are modified.

title: fix for sending 0 and false with remove_empty_properties=true

Add option to have info buttons
Add dependency system
Issue 488 fix disabled fields get enabled when using properties dropdown
body:
* Commit 1: Check if it is always disabled before enabling any editor
Otherwise editors are enabled when any properties dropdown is used.

* Commit 2: If function disable is called with param always_disabled set to true, update flag always_disabled for any editor
We need a way to tell if the disable() is called to "always disable" the editor, or just temporarily (e.g. when properties dropdown is open, it temporarily disables enabled-fields and enables them when it is closed)
It could be done in different ways, the other way I can think of is to have public "disable" and private "_disable function", and only in public one we set "always_disabled" flag to true, and then call private _disable. 
Internal disable() calls should be replaced with _disable(), and users can use editor.disable() to "always disable" the editor.

title: Fixes object properties not showing up after deleting then re-adding array row
Validation errors in programmatically-set array items do not show up
body:
The bug may appear when the following conditions are met:
- The schema contains an array
- The schema has a validation constraint (like `minLength`) on array items
- Some data, whose array item violates the constraint, is passed into JSONEditor via `setValue()`
- Theme is set to `bootstrap2` or `bootstrap3`
- The correct timing (it is a bug caused by race condition)

One would expect the validation error to show next to the input field, after using `setValue()`.

The current, unexpected behavior is that validation errors do not show up.

This is because the array items are inserted on-the-fly, and the `input.controlgroup` property may not be ready fast enough, causing `addInputError` function in the theme to simply return without inserting the error class and error message.

Reproduce this problem on...
- [JSFiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/jiehan/21grsxhs/1/)
  - (`"minLength": 100` is added to `root.parent`, which displays just fine because it is ready early enough; however, `root.children.0.child_prop` did not have any errors displayed)
- Demo page: since this is a rare race condition, some work is needed to reproduce it.  Use [this](http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor/?schema=N4IgLgngDgpiBcID2AjAVjAxmEAaEUATkrIWAJYwDOCoUAhoTAHY7yiSwIhViHnMA5nhABbAQBkWgsAAsEARgAMSgL75Ms8gBsAJk2a1w0OIkaF6EEeTAxRNdsa6JUGbCKIkYZSg9CadXQB9TygjTlMePgFhfHFmKSE5RRVVNPSgAA==&value=N4IgDghgTgpgdgFxALhCANCAxgCwJYA2AJrHCgNoC6AvkAAA&theme=bootstrap2&iconlib=fontawesome4&object_layout=normal&show_errors=always) as the base, and copy and paste the following into the data textarea, and hit Update Form.
  
  ``` json
  {
    "parent": "bad value",
    "children": [
      {
        "child_prop": "also bad"
      }
    ]
  }
  ```
  
  More often than not you will not see any errors below the input field for the child.

This PR attempts to fix the problem by adding a wait queue of callbacks that depend on `input.controlgroup` to be ready.  When it is actually ready, callbacks on the queue, including `addInputError`, will be executed.

title: Fix JS error "this.translate is not a function" (issue #637)

Add display_required_only option to editor
body:
I have a huge json schema with many options for data at many levels, but very few required parameters. Users should be required to enter only the stuff needed, but to be able to add properties when desired. I'm hoping to avoid confusing users when being presented with so many options.

Feedback always welcome.

P.S.
Thanks for making this code available!

title: Add download attribute for link tag to transfer downloaded filename
body:
This little update allows sending in link tag encoded file with ability to set this filename in new 'download' attribute for link tag. 
We've tried to use this modified version locally for our job and made decision that it will be useful for somebody else.
To describe new ability it needs to add 'download' attribute for link like:

``` js+jinja
{
  "title": "Link to downloaded file with data in it",
  "type": "string",
  "links": [
    {
      "rel": "anchor name",
      "href": "...here is base64 encoded data string with MIME...",
      "download": "filename for download"
    }
  ]
}
```

Best regards.
Stan.

- disable_array_delete_last_row: hides the button to delete the last row in an

title: Added support for uuid for strings
body:
Added option to declare a field as being UUID and get an automatic default value. We use the format type uuid.
Also there is an option to have a shorter version of the uuid, in the case you don't need so many items. The shorter version is prefixed with _ so that can be used as is or css class.
`
      "type": "string",
      "format":"uuid",
      "options" : {
        "short":true
      }
`

Hope you find this helpfull

title: Added translation support for buttons shown by array editors
body:
It turns out that the json-editor's translation support worked for error messages only, whereas my project (http://szarada.net/) needed also Polish translations of buttons shown by one of array editors.

Attached patch provides support for the localised button texts and titles, following json-editor's original translation framework principles and API-s.

Although my project uses the array.js editor only, I've provided similar translation support to the table.js editor too, to keep source code consistency.

Big thanks for the excellent JSON editor component from the Szarada.net crew!

title: Propagating "change" event of select2 select
body:
In src/editors/select.js I have registered a listener for the "change" event of a select2 dropdown. You are only listening to the "select2-blur" event, so JSON Editor fires a "change" event only when the user clicks somewhere out of the controller.

I guess you should do something similar in multiselect.js.

I have also done a build with Grunt, I hope this does not confuse you.

title: Add support for passing a theme instance as editor option
body:
I am in the process of creating a CRUD client that will programatically assemble a UI by consuming a Heroku-style JSON hyperschema. Reusing json-editor themes seemed like an ideal option, since I don't want to rely on any bloated framework.

Still, it would be nice to separate themes from the editor itself, so we don't need to have code like this:

```
theme = JSONEditor.defaults.themes["foundation5"]();
JSONEditor.defaults.theme = theme;
```

Something shorter and not tied to JSONEditor would be better. We could even extract a separate lib.

Anyway, thanks for a great lib, I hope you have time to continue working on it, I'll try to help as much as possible.

title: Allow spaces in template variables
body: This changeset adds support for spaces in template variable names, which worked up until the 0.7.19 release. An example schema that uses variables names with spaces is [here](http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor/?&value=N4IgCgpgTgzg9gOxALgNoF0A0IBqEAWAlgMYA2EKGAvkAA==&theme=bootstrap2&iconlib=fontawesome4&object_layout=normal&show_errors=interaction). Notice that when trying to add a vehicle item, there is a javascript console error.

title: Select editors values are not being casted properly

The approach for solving this has been to cast the value returned by the getValue() function instead of casting every single value passed to the this.value assignments.

title: Empty choice for non required properties in select drop downs
body:
This is a proposal fix for https://github.com/jdorn/json-editor/issues/400

If an enumerated property is not marked as required then the drop down will display an additional empty choice:

![dropdown](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2689930/8596289/6ebf4aea-264e-11e5-84cf-f513110bb64b.png)

If the empty choice is selected than the property won't be defined in the resulting JSON.

title: Remove rows from cache on deletion
body: Fixes issue #458

title: Custom styling for required properties
body:
Right now it's not possible to visually distinguish between required and not required fields at glance because all fields are displayed in bold text.
The goal of this PR is to allow users to visually customize required fields.

When a property is marked in the json schema as required:

``` json
{
  "title": "Person",
  "type": "object",
  "required":["name"], 
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "First and Last name",
      "minLength": 4,
      "default": "Jeremy Dorn"
    },
```

A new css class called "required" will be generated on the corresponding container:

``` html
<div data-schematype="string" data-schemapath="root.name" class="required"><div class="form-control">
```

If the field is not listed as required then the class won't be added.

title: add WYSIWYG support for summernote
body:
Add WYSIWYG support for [summernote](http://summernote.org/), and change option.wysiwyg from bool to string, so you could pick from SCEditor and Summernote.

I also create a new example for summernote, named summernote.html

summernote is much more popular than SCEditor, and it is in more active development. 

If the app has already imported jquery and bootstrap, summernote is a much better choice for WYSIWYG editor. 

I have also make summernote as a bower dep. So the jquery/bootstrap/fontawesome can be moved from cdn to local, which would make the development and testing faster. 

To test:

```
$ bower install
$ npm install -g http-server
$ http-server .
```

title: Fix disabling additional properties per object
body:
This makes sure that per object "additionalProperties" are correctly
evaluated and preferred over the global "no_additional_properties".

Fixes #438

title: Proposed fix 2/2 for #388
body:
This proposed fix for #388 involves replicating the bare minimum logic from math.js.

Advantages:
- Minimal changes to json-editor

Disadvantages:
- Uncertain if this method of including derivative code properly follows the [licensing restrictions](https://github.com/josdejong/mathjs/blob/master/LICENSE)
- [Copy/Paste Programming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copy_and_paste_programming) is ugly

title: Proposed fix 1/2 for #388
body:
This proposed fix for #388 involves actually including math.js.

Advantages:
- Relying directly on [math.js](http://mathjs.org/), a well-tested and well-maintained library
- Further use of floating point arithmetic can easily make use of math.js

Disadvantages:
- Huge increase (4-7x) in jsoneditor.js and jsoneditor.min.js file size
- More complicated build process

title: Allow static items for enumSource

The "source" of "enumSource" may now be an array of static items
which may be processed similarly to values from watched fields.

title: Fixed typo in CONTRIBUTING.md
No exceptions when adding unconstrained properties. Fixes #409.
Strat 79 - Added working validation for multipleOf
Adds Selectize support for array and select editors
body:
PR by myself @philostler, @radioisradio and @JulianKigwana to add Selectize support to json-editor.

Before:
![json_editor_example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/244198/7707393/6f566968-fe47-11e4-915c-a88768e389c9.png)
After:
![json_editor_example 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/244198/7707400/76cce14a-fe47-11e4-8377-c7dfe3aea7dd.png)
And a new Selectize example:
![json_editor_selectize_integration_example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/244198/7707406/818bb17e-fe47-11e4-94fc-67611bc21b38.png)

**Notes:**
We've made every effort to remain backwards compatible with how json-editor works as of now. So, as before, Select2 will be used if it is present (we didn't want to break this default behaviour).

If you want Selectize turned on then the following snippet does that for you:

``` js
JSONEditor.plugins.selectize.enable = true;
```

I think, given that you can now use Select2 and Selectize, there's a case for seperating the editors out which is what we began thinking about. You'll see that in that `array` editor for Selectize is in it's own module. 

Ultimately though that would be a larger change (and a major/minor revision increment) that would probably make selecting between Select2 and Selectize nicer as well. One idea would be to pass in the prefer enhanced UI in to the editor options. e.g.

``` js
this.editor = new JSONEditor(element, {
    enhanced_ui: 'selectize', // or 'select2' or anything else for 'default'
    schema: schema
});
```

We didn't want to undertake that as well, so this PR only includes Selectize support and no new ideas on how to better select your enhanced UI options

Enjoy!

title: Add validator context to custom validators

Hello,

currently for example the `this.translate()`-method is not available in custom validators, becuase they are called without a valid context (this). This PR changes the behaviour so that custom validators are using the same context as built-in validators.

Best regards
Benjamin

title: Add CommonJS support
body:
If the environment defines a CommonJS `module.exports` interface, export `JSONEditor` to the environment. This change adds support to build tools such as browserify. Since JSONEditor is already published to npm, it makes sense that it should be usable with tools that work with npm.

This change also maintains backwards compatibility in that it exports `window.JSONEditor` if `window` is present, even if running in a CommonJS environment.

title: Copy Array Element Button
body:
Added a copy button to the "control_holder" of an array.
If the option "enable_array_copy" (default = undefined = false) is set to true, the button is visible. 

PS: the options hide_delete_buttons, hide_move_buttons, hide_add_button can´t be overwritten if they are set as initial option.

title: Add html to description
body: It would be nice to have html in the description field.

title: Update README.md
body: corrected the syntax error in the example code of using templates

title: Add type="button" attribute to avoid <button> elements being treated as submit controls
body:
When `<button>` elements are nested inside `<form>` tags, the browser's default behavior is to treat them as `<button type="submit">`. 

This causes enter key press on any form element to trigger the click event on the first button of the form, typically the top-level collapse/expand button, as described in e.g. https://github.com/jdorn/json-editor/issues/273

This is not the expected behavior. The problem is solved by giving the button element attribute `type="button"` 

Fixes https://github.com/jdorn/json-editor/issues/273

I've got this error "Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function"
without this test.

title: Add button/placeholder translations and a complete german localization
body:
Hello Jeremy,

thanks for your very cool editor :+1:
For our project we needed a version with localized button captions, so I've created a feature branch on our fork, which you might want to integrate. If you have any suggestions for improvements they are very welcome.
I've seen #196, but it's not doing the whole translation (e.g. no button texts and no placeholder translation).

Best regards,
Benjamin

title: Type check element argument
body:
This took me a long time to figure out why it's not working. This should help in cases like that.
If element argument is not an instance of `Element` the program should fail fast and acknowledge the user.

title: Added option to override change event
body: Sometimes  we need onChange on other events than 'change'. For example 'keyup'. This is useful when you want to validate while the user is typing the text. In this proposal you only have to add a "overrideInputEvent": "keyup" attribute to the field you want to give other input event than change.

title: Use CSS instead of hardcoded styles
body:
This PR move hardcoded styles from base themes to css files through use of classes.
This could facilitate styles customizations.

title: Fixed $ref handling in schema editing
Fix move down button of array editor being show even on the last element
body:
Hello,

currently there is a small typo, which causes the move down button to be shown on the last element of an array. This PR fixes this :smile:

Regards,
Benjamin

title: Add support for labels in multiselects (options, associated to checkboxes  and select).
Prevent resolving to multiselect editor then enum_titles are specified
body:
Default **multiselect** editor does not support `enum_titles`. He just doing this:

```
this.select_values[e[i]+""] = e[i];
```

By preventing resolving to him, I made that it now resolves to **select** editor which has `enum_titles` support.

Another solution would be is to add `enum_titles` support to **multiselect** edtior.

title: Improved core and added support for describedBy hyper-link standard
body:
- Fixed $extend to clone arrays instead of copy by reference
- Improved custom validators to be called with reference to the
  validator class

title: removed setValue from switcher for oneOf, setValue was messing things up...
body: removed setValue from switcher for oneOf, setValue was messing things up by adding fields from the current editor to the one being switched to. This may need a better solution later, maybe should be mapping fields if matches can be found, but throwing out ones that don't match

body: Introduce keep_empty_properties_by_default option to force display of editors even for empty properties.

title: Properly handle cases when number extremum is 0
body: The condition does not hold when `schema.minimum` or `schema.maximum` equals 0, even if the property actually defined.

title: Update
add support for custom property sorters
body: Leaves the default property sorter to respect `propertyOrder` on schema items. Allows override with custom `propertySorter` option as custom function or as string mapping to a `JSONEditor.defaults.propertySorters` implementation.

title: Typo in filter property
body: Should cause problems when using `filter` in all `string`-based editors.

title: Add editor for n-star ratings, backed by an integer value
body:
★★★★★

Number of stars are determined by `maximum` (default: `5`) and optionally `exclusiveMaximum` (default: `false`).

``` javascript
rating: {
  type: "integer",
  format: "rating",
  maximum: "5",
  exclusiveMaximum: false,
  readonly: false
}
```

title: i18n for titles
body: This is different, and IMHO more generic approach to i18n than in #199.

title: Bind to jQuery change event when using Select2 instead of native events.
body: Select2 triggers jQuery `change` event on `select` element, so json-editor should bind to jQuery event instead of native event when Select2 is used.

title: 206 Force validation API
Fixes #186 Array item form disappears when second to last item is deleted
body: Trivial change to fix #186.

title: [String customization] Never return undefined
body:
The default `translate` function will be used if a call to the custom one returns undefined.
This is a fallback to always display something, except if the custom returns an explicit empty string.

This is useful if you want to customize only a few translation keys without redefining it via JSON `JSONEditor.defaults.languages.*` for each language, which can be pretty annoying. And it allows better synergy with other translation mechanisms / libraries.

title: number sanitizing allows scientific notation
Added option to translate schema titles
Allow translating the buttons. Partial french translation added
body: See #193

title: Use proper "cssFloat" property for reserved word float (and CamelCase "m...
body:
...arginLeft")

This is untested (esp. since "getFloatRightLinkHolder" does not seem to be in use), but "float" must be escaped to "cssFloat" (at least to work in Firefox), and "margin-left" must be CamelCased.

Note that float will not work without a width.

title: Recursive Schema Support
body:
Adds support for recursive (a.k.a. "circular" or "self-referential") schemas.  Also, make definition order not matter.

This requires a non-backwards compatible change to the Editor API, so this pull request will be the first v0.7 release.

TODO:
-  [x] Recursive schema support
  -  [x] In oneOf (not first oneOf choice)
  -  [x] In array items
  -  [x] In pattern properties
-  [x] Ignore definition declaration order when resolving references
-  [ ] Helpful warnings when infinite recursion is detected
-  [x] Way to mark object properties as not added by default
  -  [x] Recursive schema support within these non-default properties 
-  [x] Overhaul of object properties modal
-  [x] Fix broken dynamic header support (including tab labels)
-  [x] Crease recursive.html example
-  [x] Update documentation
-  [ ] Test!!!

Fixes #71 
Fixes #142 
Fixes #115 
Fixes #128 
Fixes #153 
Fixes #181 
Fixes #110

title: skip afterInputReady for temporary string editor
body: checking the self.input.parentNode will avoid calling afterInputReady on temporary string editor inputs, otherwise if the input is an ACE code editor, it will try to add an element to the missing input parentNode causing an error

title: Fixes json in package.json
Create file.js
body: Uses the existing HTML5 "file" input type when format is "file", but enhances it by populating the value with the file's DataURI using the FileReader API

title: Avoid "self" referring to "window"; adjust comment placement
body: Issue #130 wasn't actually resolved. The problem is that `self` is not defined as `this` in this particular function, so if you use the function (though you don't currently use it internally), it will treat `self` as the [global "self"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window.self) which is a reference to the `window` object.

title: CustomEvent is already polyfilled by ie9.js
body: Can just utilize standard in own function since already polyfilled

title: Ensure JSONEditor.Validator's ready is called properly when the ready ca...
body:
...llback is supplied to the init constructor on the options object (not used internally); fix comment placement

Also applies JSHint to validator file (use bracket notation for reserved keywords but otherwise use dot notation where possible; add missing semicolons, rmv redundant var declaration)

title: Clarify that schema options can be applied at the schema level or global...
body:
... level and some at the editor instance level.

I thought the README ought to follow the pattern in the other sections and mention the possibility of using the schema options on the editor instance (even though I know the options are also documented there), at least for the two which are available. Not sure if it was deliberate that `hidden` was not allowed on editor instances, but I mentioned this limitation as well.

And I thought it should be clarified that the options could be placed on the schema.

title: HTML5 expects meta charset, and FF complains in console without it; shou...
body:
...ld be before title in case special chars used within title

Hope you don't mind a few of these fairly trivial PRs... I like to first tackle the minor issues before diving into the code.

title: Fix validation when supplying value to validate()
body: Fix one issue mentioned in #119

title: Update README.md
body: A few minor issues

title: Whitespace
body: Build on the JSLint to also add whitespace checking and changes.

title: JSLint (global and jslint declaration, single use strict closure to avoi...
body:
...d repeat or non-function "use strict" statements; curly braces, upper-case (and CamelCase) constructors per JS/JSLint convention; no need for else after previous if(s) return; define var out of loops; comment out unused function param, no assignments within statement; rmv need for continue (though jslint can be configured to allow))

The JSLint site gives rationales as to why it requires these things. If you are ok with it, I can go ahead and lint the other source files as well.

There's still an odd construction to me which I didn't correct because I didn't understand what you wanted it to do:

```
    if(arguments.length === 1) {
      return this.validator.validate(arguments[1]);
```

If `arguments.length` is only one, it should be `arguments[0]`, no? Otherwise, you are just passing `undefined`.

title: Fixed default value when "type" is an array of types.
add form input[name] and label[for] attributes
body:
Support form input[name] attributes and label[for] attributes. Follows the de facto standard associative array syntax for nested values.

This opens the possibility of integration with other JavaScript form libraries that expect this convention, e.g. [jQuery Form](https://github.com/malsup/form/).

title: Add options to disable the collapse, add-property and remove-property buttons.
body:
I'd like to use this for end-users to render a normal HTML form, but the various in-built form editing tools are inappropriate for this use case. So I've added options to disable them:

```
    no_additional_properties: true,
    disable_edit_json: true,
    disable_collapse: true,
    disable_remove_links: true
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1751645/2741252/3bb6988a-c6e4-11e3-9302-bbff739d76fa.png)

title: Now all buttons have a css-class specifying its function
UI Improvements
body:
Done:
-  Grid layout
-  New styles for select/multiple/enum editors
-  New Edit JSON modal
-  New Properties modal
-  More consistent header styles across different editors
-  Updated demo with theme and icon switchers and direct link that preserves theme, iconlib, schema, and value.
-  Options to hide Edit JSON and collapse buttons (global and per-editor)
-  Update documentation
-  Testing
## Mocks/Inspiration

Edit JSON in a pop-up modal.  Disable object while editing.  Use Ace editor if available.

![editjson](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1087514/2624473/2b7b98fa-bd41-11e3-91c6-2b227b80d17c.png)

Consolidate Add Property button and add/remove property links into a single pop-up modal.  Disable object while the modal is open.  This will declutter the child editors.

![properties](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1087514/2624475/64e1c272-bd41-11e3-9a69-da0480022a6e.png)

Use grids to layout the form.  Strings get 4 columns.  Integers and numbers get 2 columns.  Textareas and code editors get 6 columns.  Objects and arrays get 12 columns.  Tables will be either 6 or 12, depending on their complexity.

![](http://designpotato.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/Pure-CSS3-Forms-Set.jpg)

More consistent treatment of labels and headers.  Right now objects and arrays use huge H3 text and other editors use normal paragraph text.  This makes objects with both types of properties look bad.

![labels](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1087514/2624510/bfb31166-bd45-11e3-9730-879270e5bba9.png)

The multiple and enum  editors look bad.  The switcher element is hard to see on the right side and the border around the element makes it look set apart from the other fields.

![switcher](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1087514/2624518/7af27246-bd46-11e3-8fef-bff815ff7f81.png)

title: New API methods 'disable' and 'enable'
Native javascript
body:
This pull request removes jQuery as a dependency. This is a large rewrite, but it will result in huge performance gains as well as lowering the requirements to include JSON editor in an existing project. After this, the project will have no required dependencies! TODO: - testing!!! Performance Results: complex schema with many large nested arrays and lots of templates and inner linking:
ActionjQuery (ms)Native (ms)
Initialization16949
Set Value391491594
Responsive after setting value~28000~0
Watched field change populate throughout editor~5000~0
Delete an array row~51000~1000
Add an array row~2000~500
Move array row~10000~500
